more.title: How the Skeleton of Mutapa Times is Based on Sarah Charlesworth's Work
more.description: Conceptual artist Sarah Charlesworth's 1979 study of how newspapers covered a solar eclipse inspired the framework behind The Mutapa Times.

more.title: Retail giant OK Zimbabwe goes under corporate rescue after massive losses, revenue collapse
more.description: EMBATTLED retail giant OK Zimbabwe has been placed under Corporate Rescue following a resolution passed by its board of directors, as the company battles a deepening financial crisis marked by heavy losses, store closures and declining creditor confidence. Once regarded as one of Zimbabwe’s largest and most dominant retail chains, the company is now navigating [...]The post Retail giant OK Zimbabwe goes under corporate rescue after massive losses, revenue collapse appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.title: Parliament invites public input on Constitutional Amendment (No.3) Bill which proposes extension of presidential term
more.description: The Parliament of Zimbabwe has invited the public to submit their views on the proposed Constitution of Zimbabwe Amendment (No. 3) Bill (H.B. 1), 2026, following its recent gazetting. The proposed amendment includes extending the presidential term from the current five years to seven years and introducing a parliamentary process for the election of the [...]The post Parliament invites public input on Constitutional Amendment (No.3) Bill which proposes extension of presidential term appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.title: Academies plan massive protest over exorbitant ZIFA charges, set to petition Magwizi
more.description: – We were never consulted, we don’t know who spoke on our behalf FOOTBALL academies operating across Zimbabwe are set to deliver a petition in protest to ZIFA’s recent decision to hike registration fees, annual levies and player registration charges. more.title: Former footballers Abbas Amidu, Reuben Mhlanga sentenced to 12 years in jail prison for drug dealing
more.description: Former CAPS United and Kaizer Chiefs player Abbas Amidu has been sentenced to 12 years in prison after being convicted of dealing in dangerous drugs. Amidu was sentenced alongside his accomplice, Reuben Kudzai Mhlanga, a former Dynamos player. The duo was arrested in June last year along the Harare-Bulawayo highway after they were found in [...]The post Former footballers Abbas Amidu, Reuben Mhlanga sentenced to 12 years in jail prison for drug dealing appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.title: Zimbabwe can fund it’s health sector with minerals says Hwende, labels US$367 million American deal a joke
more.description: Opposition legislator Chalton Hwende has said that Zimbabwe possesses the capacity to finance its own healthcare system without relying on external support, provided that corruption in the mineral resources sector is addressed. Hwende’s sentiments follow President Emmerson Mnangagwa’s decision to terminate a proposed five-year health funding deal with the United States, worth US$367 million. In [...]The post Zimbabwe can fund it’s health sector with minerals says Hwende, labels US$367 million American deal a joke appeared first on NewZimbabwe.com.

more.description: The New Zealand women’s national cricket team, the White Ferns, secured a 92-run victory over Zimbabwe in the opening match of their T20 International series at Seddon Park. more.title: NGO petitions Parliament to enact new law protecting Zimbabwe’s senior citizens, pensioners
more.description: A non-governmental organisation, Power of Touch Institution, has petitioned Parliament to enact legislation specifically designed to protect senior citizens, pensioners and retired professionals amid growing concerns over their welfare.
